title: Virtual Event: Planning for Climate Resilience in the U.S. Air Force
descriptions: RAND Project AIR FORCE will host a virtual event exploring the potential security, strategic, and geopolitical implications of climate change; the use of wargames to understand operational challenges; and analytic methods for prioritizing resilience investments to mitigate risks.

image.desc: A Boeing 787 Dreamliner soaks in -45 degrees inside the McKinley Climatic Lab at Eglin Air Force Base, Florida, April 21, 2010, photo by U.S. Air Force

sub_content.What: Extreme weather and climate change pose a number of challenges to the Department of the Air Force, making resilience to climate effects a critical piece of the department's broader national security goals. RAND Project AIR FORCE will host a virtual event exploring the potential security, strategic, and geopolitical implications of climate change; the use of wargames to understand operational challenges; and analytic methods for prioritizing resilience investments to mitigate risks.
